TopicTitle: Controlling a spacecraft from a command seat

Articles.Content:
I built an escape pod for my space station, but I cant control its rotation from a command seat, even though it has an SAS.

Does anyone know why this is?

SAS does not provide any control torque, only to stabilize. The command seats don't provide any torque at all. So you have nothing to steer with. If you could replace the SAS with a probe core or RGU then you would have some.

Edited July 13, 2013 by Rhomphaia
^What he said. Alternatively, if you keep a command pod on board, it will provide (much more) torque to control your station.

Thanks! I should have read the wiki more thoroughly

"SAS units exert torque to stop vessel rotation. This torque is not available to the command unit for control authority"
